meanings.definition: To treat with a superficial or condescending manner.
meanings.sent1: She was patinizing her classmates by acting like she was better than them.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was patinizing the students by talking down to them.
meanings.sent3: He thought he was being funny by patinizing his friends, but they didn't appreciate it.
meanings.sent4: The politician's patinizing attitude towards the voters was transparent and insincere.
meanings.sent5: Her constant patinizing tone made others feel belittled and unimportant.

meanings.definition: To coat or cover with a thin layer of a substance.
meanings.sent1: She was patinizing the metal with a shiny finish to protect it from rust.
meanings.sent2: The artist was patinizing the sculpture with a layer of bronze paint.
meanings.sent3: He enjoyed patinizing his car with a new coat of wax every weekend.
meanings.sent4: The chef was patinizing the cake with a thin layer of glaze for a glossy look.
meanings.sent5: The craftsman was patinizing the furniture with a special varnish to enhance its appearance.

meanings.definition: To make something appear older or worn by applying a patina.
meanings.sent1: She was patinizing the picture frame to give it a vintage look.
meanings.sent2: The antique dealer was patinizing the furniture to increase its value.
meanings.sent3: He was patinizing the new mirror to match the rustic decor of his room.
meanings.sent4: The artist was patinizing the statue to create an aged effect for realism.
meanings.sent5: The designer was patinizing the metal accessories to achieve an antique appearance.
